programName: Materials Science & Engineering and Business Administration (B.S. MET)
fullProgramDescription: The Materials Science & Engineering and Business Administration program is an interdisciplinary major that combines the study of materials science and engineering with business administration. Students in this program gain a strong foundation in materials science and engineering, as well as coursework in business administration, preparing them for careers at the intersection of technology and business.
shortProgramDescription: The Materials Science & Engineering and Business Administration program at UC Berkeley combines coursework in materials science and engineering with business administration, preparing students for careers in technology and business.
classHighlights: Students take core courses in materials science and engineering, including thermodynamics, kinetics, and structure and properties of materials.
The program includes coursework in business administration, such as financial management, marketing, and organizational behavior.
Materials science and engineering electives allow students to explore specific areas, such as biomaterials, nanomaterials, or energy materials.
Business administration electives provide students with the opportunity to specialize in areas like finance, marketing, or entrepreneurship.
The program requires a laboratory course in materials science and engineering, where students gain hands-on experience with materials characterization and processing.
Students also complete coursework in mathematics and physics, providing a strong foundation for understanding materials science and engineering principles.
learningOutcomes: Apply knowledge of materials science and engineering to solve problems in a business context.
Understand the principles of business administration and management.
Analyze and design materials and systems for specific applications.
Communicate technical and business concepts effectively.
Work effectively in teams to solve complex problems.
Understand the societal and environmental implications of materials science and engineering.
additionalInformation: The program is highly competitive and requires a strong academic record. Students must complete a set of required courses in materials science and engineering and business administration, as well as electives in both areas.
